oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dry Cow Therapy and Mastitis Control, An Observational Study
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sischo, W. M.
Miller, G. Y.
Heider, L. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mastitis control
dairy
observational studies
cow therapy
dry cow therapy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A cross-sectional study involving 1032 dairy farms in Ohio was conducted with the objective to evaluate the effectiveness of mastitis control measures in a contemporary dairy environment. Recently published observational studies have found varying effectiveness of common mastitis control practices, particularly nonlactating cow therapy (dry cow therapy, DCT).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1991; 179-180
